descriptions.title: An Overview of the Jero/Jerung Region
descriptions.content: The Jero or Jerung are a Rai ethnic group of eastern Nepal who speak a Tibeto-Burman language of the same name and which is a Kiranti language. According to the 2001 census of Nepal, 271 people speak Jero as a mother tongue. (Mark Turin – June 01, 2004)
